|cpu1chip1 = Atheros;AR9344; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 74Kc |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 560<!-- 560 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = 32-bit
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Spansion;S25FL064KIF; |flash1size = 8 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 128 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5PS5162GFR; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Atheros;AR8327N; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = <!-- 10MbE,100MbE,1GbE, --> |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = C0:4A:00 |oui = C0:4A:00
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = U-Boot;;; |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_sim_num = <!-- Number of sim Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_pcmcia_num = <!-- Number of pcmcia ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_expcard_num = <!-- Number of Expresscard ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipci_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCI Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipcie_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCIexpress Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_usb_num = 2 |exp_cf_num = <!-- Number Compact Flash Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sdmmc_num = <!-- Number SD/MMC Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ide_num = <!-- Number of ide ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ata_num = <!-- Number of ATA Ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sata_num = <!-- Number of sata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_esata_num = <!-- Number of esata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_parallel = <!-- Number of parallel ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sfp_num = <!-- Number of sfp ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_M.2 = <!-- Number of M.2 ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_hdmi_num = |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.56 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner = 2.1 |pwr_barrel_len = 9.5 |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = abgn
|defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = OpenWrt, DD-WRT
|availability = Discontinued |eoldate = 2015 |fccapprovdate = 06/06/2012 |estreldate = 06/13/2012 |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 845973051938 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B0088CJT4U |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = <!-- full chip info --> |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Atheros;AR9580; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== See also the [[TP-LINK TL-WDR4310]] which shares the same hardware. :The '''Mercury''' MW4530R probably <small>([https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=36534&p=3 on the '''OpenWrt Forums''']) :</small> also shares the same hardware (minus a USB port).
"2050500224 Rev:1.0" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :A ''Genesys Logic'' [http://www.genesyslogic.com/en/product_view.php?show=21 GL850G] [[USB Host Controllers|USB 2.0 Hub controller]] is in use.
===HW Versions=== v1.7 * RAM: ''Zentel'' A3R1GE40CBF * Flash: ''Winbond'' W25Q64FVSIG v1.6 * RAM: ''Winbond'' W975166KB * Flash: ''Winbond'' W25Q64FVSIG
===PSU=== Power supplies, as shown in the FCC photos, are... *US: '''Leader Electronics''' MU18-2120150-A1 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 1.5A) *Australia: '''Leader Electronics''' MU18-2120150-A3 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 1.5A) *UK: '''Leader Electronics''' MU18-2120150-B2 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 1.5A) *Euro: '''Leader Electronics''' MU18-2120150-C5 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 1.5A)
==Links of Interest== *[http://www.tp-link.com/resources/simulator/TL-WDR4300/Index.htm Firmware Interface] {{•}} [http://www.tplink.com/en/support/download/?model=TL-WDR4300&version=V1 Downloads] *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/tp-link/tl-wdr4300 ''TP-Link TL-WDR4300'' on the '''OpenWrt Wiki'''] :"2050500231 Rev:1.0" is silkscreened on the board photo (v1.1). *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=36534 ''TP-Link TL-WDR4310 v1.0 First Steps'' on the '''OpenWrt Forums'''] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=156445&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=30 ''Working build'' on '''DD-WRT Forum'''] *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/other/ces-2012/31671-ces-2012-tp-link-announcements ''CES 2012: TP-Link Announcements'' - '''SmallNetBuilder''']
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = tl-wdr4300v1 build 19644 20120808
Please insert instructions here
===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/tp-link/tp-link_tl-wdr4300 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/tp-link/tl-wdr4300_v1 |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=36534 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = 14.07 |current_supported_version = 23.05.0 |comment = v1.0, v1.1, v1.2, v1.3, v1.4, v1.5, v1.6, v1.7 }} Please insert instructions here
==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== AR9344 Support two JTAG modes: :Plain JTAG and EJTAG for debugging. To enable EJTAG mode you will need to remove :bootstrap resistor marked on this image: <gallery> File:TL-WDR4300 20160115 140517 ejtag.jpg|EJTAG </gallery>
If u-boot is not damaged and you won't to experiment with EJTAG, :then you will need to disable at least /CS pin of SPI chip. :You can see it on this picture too.
==Pictures== <center>'''Retail Images''' <gallery caption="from TP-LINK"> File:TL-WDR4300-01.jpg|main File:TL-WDR4300-02.jpg|back File:TL-WDR4300-03.jpg|angled1 File:TL-WDR4300-04.jpg|angled2 File:TL-WDR4300-05.jpg|top </gallery></center>[[Has images::retail| ]][[Has images::external| ]] <center>'''User Images''' <gallery caption="from Fishor" mode="slideshow"> File:TL-WDR4300 20160115 140617.jpg File:TL-WDR4300 20160115 140517.jpg File:TL-WDR4300 20160115 140547.jpg File:TL-WDR4300 20160111 163809.jpg File:TL-WDR4300 20160115 140517 ejtag.jpg </gallery></center>[[Has images::internal| ]]
